TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit StrokeCollectionConverter extends System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter

remarks.format: ## Remarks The converts a to a string that represents the in base-64, encoded Ink Serialized Format (ISF). It is useful to store ink data as base-64, encoded ISF when it is not possible to store raw byte data, such as in Web pages. ## XAML Text Usage ## Examples The following example demonstrates how to convert a base-64, encoded ISF string to a . This assumes that there is an called `presenter`. remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.StrokeCollectionConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> method returns `null` if `value` is not a <xref:System.String>.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to convert a base-64, encoded Ink Serialized Format (ISF) string to a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>. This assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkPresenter> called `presenter`.
[!code-csharp[InkEraser#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/InkEraser/CSharp/InkEraser.cs#8)] [!code-vb[InkEraser#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/InkEraser/VisualBasic/InkEraser.vb#8)] [!code-csharp[InkEraser#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/InkEraser/CSharp/InkEraser.cs#3)] [!code-vb[InkEraser#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/InkEraser/VisualBasic/InkEraser.vb#3)]

.method public hidebysig virtual instance object ConvertTo(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value, class System.Type destinationType) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
The to use as the current culture.
Docs.returns: An object that represents the specified .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.StrokeCollectionConverter.ConvertTo%2A> method returns `null` if `value` is not a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>, or if `destinationType` is not <xref:System.String> or <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor>.
The <xref:System.Windows.StrokeCollectionConverter.ConvertTo%2A> method returns a base-64, encoded Ink Serialized Format (ISF). It is useful to store ink data as base-64, encoded ISF when it is not possible to store raw byte data, such as in Web pages.
